com.soa.message

Class AbstractMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.soa.message.AbstractMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Message
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleMessage

    public abstract class AbstractMessage
extends java.lang.Object
implements Message
    Abstract implementation of Message interface that can be easily extended for specific implementations.
    Since:
    5.0.

      • getPropertyNames

        public java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns the names of the properties associated with the message. Changes made to the Set are reflected in the message, so if a name is removed from the Set, the property is removed from the message. Names cannot be added however.
        Specified by:
        getPropertyNames in interface Message
        Returns:
        Set of String property names.

      • getProperties

        public java.util.Map getProperties()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Provides direct access to the Map of properties for the message. Do NOT make changes to the returned Map.
        Specified by:
        getProperties in interface Message
        Returns:
        Map of properties keyed by Strings.

        Parameters:

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns the ID of the message (if any). An ID is typically used when the message is part of an asynchronous exchange. It may not be available for synchronous exchanges. If present, the ID will be unique between the producer and consumer of the messsage while the exchange it is part of is active.
        Specified by:
        getID in interface Message
        Returns:
        String identifier of the message, null if none available.

      • setID

        public void setID(java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Changes the ID of the message. The ID will be unique between the producer and consumer of the messsage while the exchange it is part of is active.
        Specified by:
        setID in interface Message
        Parameters:
        id - String identifier of the message.

      • getCorrelationID

        public java.lang.String getCorrelationID()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns a correlation identifier (if any) that can be used to correlate this message with another. The most common example is for correlating an asynchronous response to a request message. This would be done by using the request message's ID as the response message's correlation ID.
        Specified by:
        getCorrelationID in interface Message
        Returns:
        String correlation identifier, null if none available.

      • setCorrelationID

        public void setCorrelationID(java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Changes the correlation ID of the message. The most common use is for asynchronous messaging. The request message ID would be set as the response message's correlation ID.
        Specified by:
        setCorrelationID in interface Message
        Parameters:
        id - String correlation identifier.

      • setSecuritySubject

        public void setSecuritySubject(javax.security.auth.Subject subject)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Changes the security subject for the message with the consumer subject category (urn:org:federatedgovernance:security:subject-category:consumer). The security subject identifies the entity sending the message. This is a convenience method as a Map of all subjects associated with the message can be accessed through the MessageProperties.SECURITY_SUBJECTS property.
        Specified by:
        setSecuritySubject in interface Message
        Parameters:
        subject - Subject identifying the application sending the message.

      • getSecuritySubject

        public javax.security.auth.Subject getSecuritySubject()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns the security subject for the message with the consumer subject category (urn:org:federatedgovernance:security:subject-category:consumer). The security subject identifies the entity sending the message. This is a convenience method as a Map of all subjects associated with the message can be accessed through the MessageProperties.SECURITY_SUBJECTS property.
        Specified by:
        getSecuritySubject in interface Message
        Returns:
        Subject identifying the application sending the message.

      • getTransportHeaders

        public Headers getTransportHeaders()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns the transport headers associated with the message (if any). This is a convenience method as the same headers can be accessed through the MessageProperties.TRANSPORT_HEADERS property.
        Specified by:
        getTransportHeaders in interface Message
        Returns:
        Headers holding transport headers for the message, null if none present.

      • setTransportHeaders

        public void setTransportHeaders(Headers headers)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Replaces the set of transport headers associated with the message. This is a convenience method as the same headers can be accessed through the MessageProperties.TRANSPORT_HEADERS property.
        Specified by:
        setTransportHeaders in interface Message
        Parameters:
        headers - Headers holding transport headers for the message.

      • canCarryBindingHeaders

        public boolean canCarryBindingHeaders()
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Returns if the message can carry binding headers. Some types of messages are sent using protocols that don't support binding headers. Indicating that can save processing time during mediation.
        Specified by:
        canCarryBindingHeaders in interface Message
        Returns:
        true if binding headers may be use, false if not.

        Specified by:

        Returns:
        String URI of the message's binding, null if normalized.

      • setContentType

        public void setContentType(java.lang.String contentType)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Changes the type of content of the message, i.e., application/xml, application/json. This must match what is returned in Message.getContent().
        Specified by:
        setContentType in interface Message
        Parameters:
        contentType - Type of message content.
